cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW through the northern Leeward Islands and northern Caribbean, forecast to turn northwest near Cuba and toward the Florida Peninsula late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys or southwest Florida coast (near Naples/Marathon area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Florida at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, Cuba and potentially the Florida Peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force winds are currently a 33% cumulative chance; hurricane‐force winds cannot be ruled out if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Irma tracks up or just offshore the west Florida coast, surge of 3–6 ft in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee, is possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 6–10 inches of rain capable of localized flooding in Manatee County.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and possible port closure due to swell and high waves.
